title: Spanish cultural studies : an introduction : the struggle for modernity

publisher: Oxford ; New York : Oxford University Press
description: This work adopts an interdisciplinary approach in its study of 20th-century Spanish culture and society, emphasizing contemporary developments. The contributors take into account major recent changes which have taken place in the context of higher education Spanish studies.
contents: Culture and identity : the case of Spain / Helen Graham and Jo Labanyi -- Part I. Elites in crisis, 1898-1931 -- The loss of empire, regenerationism, and the forging of a myth of national identity / Sebastian Balfour -- The nationalisms of the periphery : culture and politics in the construction of national identity / Enric Ucelay Da Cal -- The social praxis and cultural politics of Spanish Catholicism / Frances Lannon -- Education and the limits of liberalism / Jose Alvarez Junco -- Literary modernism in Castilian : the creation of a dissident cultural elite / Chris Perriam -- Catalan literary modernism and noucentisme : from dissidence to order / Arthur Terry -- Catalan modernista architecture : using the past to build the modern / Emma Dent Coad -- The literary avant-garde : a contradictory modernity / Sue Frenck, Chris Perriam and Mike Thompson -- Internationalism and eclecticism : surrealism and the avant-garde in painting and film, 1920-1930 / Dawn Ades -- The musical avant-garde : modernity and tradition / Julian White -- Rural and urban popular cultures / Jose Alvarez Junco -- The cuple : modernity and mass culture / Serge Salaun -- Part II. The failure of democratic modernization, 1931-1939 -- Women and social change / Helen Graham -- Beyond tradition and "modernity" : the cultural and sexual politics of Spanish anarchism / Richard Cleminson -- Reform idealized : the intellectual and ideological origins of the Second Republic / Enrique Montero -- The republican state and mass educational-cultural initiatives, 1931-1936 / Christopher Cobb -- The political debate within Catholicism / Frances Lannon -- Catalan nationalism : cultural plurality and political ambiguity / Enric Ucelay Da Cal -- The republican and nationalist wartime cultural apparatus / Alicia Alted -- Propaganda art : culture by the people or for the people? / Jo Labanyi -- Part III. Authoritarian modernization, 1940-1975 -- "Terror and progress" : industrialization, modernity, and the making of Francoism / Mike Richards -- Gender and the state : women in the 1940s / Helen Graham -- Education and political control / Alicia Alted -- The moving image of the Franco regime : noticiariosy documentales, 1943-1975 / Sheelagh Ellwood -- The ideology and practice of sport / John London -- Censorshop or the fear of mass culture / Jo Labanyi -- Cifesa : cinema and authoritarian aesthetics / Peter Evans -- Constructing the nation : Francoist architecture / Emma Dent Coad -- Music and the limits of cultural nationalism / Julian White -- The urban and rural guerrilla of the 1940s / Paul Preston -- Popular culture in the "years of hunger" / Helen Graham -- The emergency of a dissident intelligentsia / Barry Jordan -- Social and economic change in a climate of political immobilism / Borja de Riquer Permanyer I -- Educational policy in a changing society / Alicia Alted -- Catholicism and social change / Frances Lannon -- The left and the legacy of Francoism : political culture in opposition and transition / Elias Diaz -- The politics of popular music : on the dynamics of new song / Catherine Boyle -- Literary experiment and cultural cannibalization / Jo Labanyi -- Painting and sculpture : the rejection of high art / Emma Dent Coad -- Cinema, memory, and the unconscious / Peter Evans -- Part IV. Democracy and Europeanization : continuity and change, 1975-1992 -- Political transition and cultural democracy : coping with the speed of change / Rosa Montero -- Educational policy in democratic Spain / Alicia Alted -- Back to the future : cinema and democracy / Peter Evans -- Some perspectives on the nation-state and autonomies in Spain / Antonio Elorza -- The politics of language : Spain's minority languages / Clare Mar-Molinero -- Becoming normal : cultural production and cultural policy in Catalonia / Josep-Anton Fernandez -- Negotiating Galician cultural identity / Xelis de Toro Santos -- The promotion of cultural production in Basque / Jesus maria Lasagabaster --The mass media : a problematic modernization / Enrique Bustamante -- Redefining the public interest : television in Spain today / Barry Jordan -- The film industry : under pressure from the state and television / Augusto M. Torres -- Artistic patronage and enterprise culture / Emma Dent Coad -- Designer culture in the 1980s : the price of success / Emma Dent Coad -- The silent revolution : the social and cultural advances of women in democratic Spain / Rosa Montero -- Work, women, and the family : a critical perspective / Anny Brooksbank Jones -- Gay and lesbian culture / Chris Perriam -- Postmodernism and the problem of cultural identity / Jo Labanyi -- The politics of 1992 / Helen Graham and Antonio Sanchez.

abstract: This work adopts an interdisciplinary approach in its study of 20th-century Spanish culture and society, emphasizing contemporary developments. The contributors take into account major recent changes which have taken place in the context of higher education Spanish studies.
btitle: Spanish cultural studies : an introduction : the struggle for modernity
